page.title: 13ULLAPOOL MEMORIES-J.MACLEOD.
page.content: I hardly know anyone in the village today.Eighty years ago we knew every- one and neighbours helped each other in every possible way.Today with so much home entertainment on television and video,people don't 'ceilidh'-visit as much as they used to because the pattern of life has changed. When I was a girl most families had a cow and half an acre of land in or around the village.A horse and plough turned the ground and everyone helped to plant potatoes and some corn for feeding the cows.Some of our calves were bought by Kenny'Drover'Macrae for 5 shillings or slaughtered for veal. A youth was employed as a herd boy to take the cows to the common grazing up the hill and bring them home at night. All the owners would give a few pence per week so that the youth would be paid half-a-crown for his work.
